newsitem.title: USA: KirchGroup takes stake in Regency Enterprises.
newsitem.headline: KirchGroup takes stake in Regency Enterprises.

text.p: European media firm KirchGroup said Thursday it has committed to acquire a 7.5 percent equity stake in Regency Enterprises a privately held movie production company primarily owned by Arnon Milchan.
The investment gives Regency a value of $850 million and will be made in two stages, with the first stage giving Leo Kirch, founder of KirchGroup a 5 percent ownership.
"We are very excited to enter into this new relationship with Leo Kirch," said Milchan in a statement.

Regency known primarily as a film production and distribution company is aggressively increasing its televsion production. The company also said it plans to enter the music business with a soon to be announced acquisition of a record company.
Regency's recent films include "Tin Cup," "Time to Kill," "Heat," "JFK," and "Pretty Woman."
